metadata.Title: CVE-2019-9878 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
There is an invalid memory access in the function GfxIndexedColorSpace::mapColorToBase() located in GfxState.cc in Xpdf 4.0.0, as used in pdfalto 0.2. It can be triggered by (for example) sending a crafted pdf file to the pdftops binary. It allows an attacker to cause Denial of Service (Segmentation fault) or possibly have unspecified other impact.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-9878` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.76.1-0ubuntu3
libpoppler-cpp0v5 - 0.76.1-0ubuntu3
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.76.1-0ubuntu3
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.76.1-0ubuntu3
libpoppler111 - 0.76.1-0ubuntu3
poppler-utils - 0.76.1-0ubuntu3
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> xpdf in koffice is 2.0 mdeslaur> can't reproduce with poppler, no indication it is affected ebarretto> since 0.5.12-1 libextractor does not use xpdf anymore.

criterions.comment: poppler package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.76.1-0ubuntu3').
xpdf package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
